Package edu.cnm.deepdive.powdr.controller

Class MessageController

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cnm.deepdive.powdr.controller.MessageController
  • @RestController
@RequestMapping("/messages")
@ExposesResourceFor(Message.class)
public class MessageController
extends java.lang.Object
    REST Controller class for Message to receive parameter values taken from HTTP requests to their respective specified URL endpoints, and returning serialized JSON object results to HTTP responses.

      Constructs an instance of MessageService.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        @GetMapping(value="/{messageId}",
            produces="application/json")
public Message get​(@PathVariable
                   java.util.UUID messageId,
                   org.springframework.security.core.Authentication auth)
        Gets a message according to it's specified ID, or else throws a NoSuchElementException if none are found.
        Parameters:
        messageId - ID of the message in the database
        auth - Security Authentication
        Returns:
        A message, or else throw a NoSuchElementException.

      • getAll

        @GetMapping(produces="application/json")
public java.util.List<Message> getAll​(@RequestBody
                                      User sender,
                                      @RequestBody
                                      User receiver,
                                      org.springframework.security.core.Authentication auth)
        Gets all messages specified through the specified sender/receiver.
        Parameters:
        sender - User who sent the message.
        receiver - User who receives the message.
        auth - Security Authentication
        Returns:
        A list of messages of the specified sender/receiver.

      • post

        @PostMapping(produces="application/json",
             consumes="application/json")
@ResponseStatus(CREATED)
public Message post​(@RequestBody
                    Message message,
                    org.springframework.security.core.Authentication auth)
        Posts a message to the server.
        Parameters:
        auth - User who first sent the message.
        message - Message between the two Users.
        Returns:
        The message between the two users.

      • delete

        @DeleteMapping("/{messageId}")
@ResponseStatus(NO_CONTENT)
public void delete​(@PathVariable
                   java.util.UUID messageId,
                   org.springframework.security.core.Authentication auth)
        Deletes a Message according to the specified ID in the database if one is present.
        Parameters:
        messageId - ID of the Message
        auth - Security Authentication
